item.title: Ticket #1734 (WP.com stripping part of hotlink tags when no space before ...) created
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
ENV: WP.com from Flock Web Browser using XML-RPC

I am a member of the Flock development team. It appears that WP.com is stripping parts of an <img .../> that seem to be valid XHTML. This problem occured a couple of days ago when WP.com first implemented image upload, and went away right after. The bug is back.

Our blog editor is uploading: <img src="​http://photos33.flickr.com/45138805_aa25c18460_m.jpg" alt="Flickr Photo"/> when I view it in "manage" the source looks like <img />

If I enter the source directly it becomes: <img alt="Flickr Photo" src="​http://photos33.flickr.com/45138805_aa25c18460_m.jpg" /> which is much better ;-)

Concurrently, we are working to put a space prior to the closing, "/>".

item.title: Ticket #899 (Wishlist item: hooks for file uploads) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Per a recent discussion with Matt, the wp_posts.post_status value 'object' is for recording (but not storing) uploads as post children. It is used in the new image-uploading.php and there are now object handlers in functions-post.php. A file_upload action hook should be added to any uploading functions. It should only need one parameter: post_ID.

That is, unless you plan on uploading files that aren't attached to posts.

item.title: Ticket #1554 (rich editor doesn't work) closed
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
wontfix:

Apparently it was an OS-specific browser bug, possibly config related; a flash in the pan. FF 1.0.6+ can use the editor on many other platforms, including Linux flavors. Unless someone comes forward with some debug data, this should be closed.

item.title: Ticket #1715 (pluggable function replace error) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Cc changed

Attached diff does the job in two redirects so it never loads a new plugin out of sequence. First request adds the plugin to active_plugins. Plugin loads on second request, then activate_$plugin is done, then redirect back to plugins.php for success message.

Needs testing.

item.title: Ticket #1730 (More and Next Page buttons broken in TinyMCE) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
This is the quickest fix. By reintroducing support for <img name="..." /> the plugin works again. If the name attribute is out of the question, I can change the plugin to use the class attribute instead.

Also, the plugin list in tinyMCE.init is strictly comma separated. It doesn't get trimmed, so spaces become a monkey wrench.

item.title: Ticket #1729 (Double-dash in blog URL gets replaced with long dash (bloginfo)) created
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
If -- is used in the blog URL, WordPress replaces with a – aka – when called via bloginfo(). bloginfo() shouldn't wptexturize() the URL outputs.

Reported here: ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/46086

item.title: Ticket #1727 (broken gettext in PHP 4.4.0) created
item.dc:creator: fredCZ
item.description:
This part of code from gettext.php says everyting:

$MAGIC1 = (int)0x950412de; bug? in PHP 5
$MAGIC1 = (int) - 1794895138; bug? in PHP 4.4.0
$MAGIC1 = 2500072158; works with PHP 4.4.0 but no tested anywhere else

$MAGIC2 = (int)0xde120495; bug?
$MAGIC2 = (int) - 569244523; bug? in PHP 4.4.0
$MAGIC2 = 3725722773; works with PHP 4.4.0 but no tested anywhere else

item.title: Ticket #1726 (Post image upload have bad permissions) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
For information:

Line 128 of upload.php reads: 

			chmod($pathtofile2, 0666);

Line 94 of image-uploading.php reads: 

chmod($file, 0775);

item.title: Ticket #1726 (Post image upload have bad permissions) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: 755 sounds good to me. Any other comments on this before I change it?
